ray.rml

Interface Quaternion

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Addable<Quaternion>, Bufferable, java.lang.Comparable<Quaternion>, FourDimensional, Invertible<Quaternion>, LinearlyInterpolable<Quaternion>, Multiplicable<Quaternion>, Negatable<Quaternion>, Normalizable<Quaternion>, ScalarProduct<Quaternion>, SphericallyInterpolable<Quaternion>, Subtractable<Quaternion>, ThreeDimensional, TwoDimensional
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Quaternionf

    public interface Quaternion
extends FourDimensional, Addable<Quaternion>, Subtractable<Quaternion>, Multiplicable<Quaternion>, ScalarProduct<Quaternion>, Normalizable<Quaternion>, Invertible<Quaternion>, java.lang.Comparable<Quaternion>, Bufferable, LinearlyInterpolable<Quaternion>, SphericallyInterpolable<Quaternion>, Negatable<Quaternion>
    A quaternion represents an orientation about an axis in 3D space.

    Quaternions have a scalar part, which correlates to an angle of rotation, and a vector part, which represents the axis of rotation. Note that the encoded scalar part is not encoded as an angle directly. This means that quaternion q = [w, v] = [w, v=(x, y, z)], where w is the scalar part and v is the vector part, is defined as follows: 

     w = cos(theta/2)
 v = [x * sin(theta/2), y * sin(theta/2), z * sin(theta/2)]
    where theta is the actual angle of rotation around v, in radians. This means extraction of the w and v components is as follows: 

     theta = 2 * arccos(w)
 v     = [x / sin(theta/2), y / sin(theta/2), z / sin(theta/2)]
    Author:
    Raymond L. Rivera

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Angle angle()
      Returns the angle of rotation encoded by this quaternion.
      Vector3 axis()
      Returns the rotation axis of this quaternion as a vector.
      Quaternion conjugate()
      Returns the conjugate of this quaternion as a new quaternion.
      Vector3 rotate(Vector3 v)
      Rotate the specified vector by this quaternion.
      Vector4 rotate(Vector4 v)
      Rotate the specified vector by this quaternion.
      Matrix3 toMatrix3()
      Converts this quaternion to a pure rotation matrix.
      Matrix4 toMatrix4()
      Converts this quaternion to a matrix, representing a rotation with no translation.

    • Method Detail

      • angle

        Angle angle()
        Returns the angle of rotation encoded by this quaternion.
        Returns:
        The angle of rotation.

      • axis

        Vector3 axis()
        Returns the rotation axis of this quaternion as a vector.
        Returns:
        The vector rotation axis.

      • rotate

        Vector3 rotate(Vector3 v)
        Rotate the specified vector by this quaternion.
        Parameters:
        v - The vector to be rotated by this quaternion.
        Returns:
        A new vector with the rotation applied.

      • rotate

        Vector4 rotate(Vector4 v)
        Rotate the specified vector by this quaternion.
        Parameters:
        v - The vector to be rotated by this quaternion.
        Returns:
        A new vector with the rotation applied.

      • conjugate

        Quaternion conjugate()
        Returns the conjugate of this quaternion as a new quaternion.

        The conjugate q' of a quaternion q = (w, [x, y, z]) is defined as: 

         q' = (w, [-x, -y, -z])
        Returns:
        A new quaternion that is the conjugate of this quaternion.

      • toMatrix3

        Matrix3 toMatrix3()
        Converts this quaternion to a pure rotation matrix.
        Returns:
        The orientation represented by this quaternion as a pure rotation matrix.

      • toMatrix4

        Matrix4 toMatrix4()
        Converts this quaternion to a matrix, representing a rotation with no translation.
        Returns:
        The orientation represented by this quaternion as a matrix with a rotation and no translation.
